definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
lit. heaven won't let the sparrows go hungry (idiom)/fig. don't give up hope/if you tough it out, there will be light at the end of the tunnel
pinyin: lao3 tian1 ye2 e4 bu4 si3 xia1 jia1 que4

sentences.english: One of the ways we train for godliness is by maintaining our physical health.
sentences.chinese: 保持身體健康就是我們爲老天爺做的事情之一。

sentences.english: I would never believe that Londoners would pray for rain.
sentences.chinese: 我永遠也不相信倫敦人會祈求老天爺下雨。

sentences.english: Heaven only aided those who endeavoured to help themselves .
sentences.chinese: 老天爺只幫助那些自力更生的人。

sentences.english: But some are like, 'Oh, my God, now it makes sense.
sentences.chinese: 但還有些會說，‘哦，老天爺，現在知道怎麼回事了。

sentences.english: They called down punishment on the people for their evil ways.
sentences.chinese: 他們祈求老天爺懲罰那些作惡多端的人。

sentences.english: Is Sky-Grandfather readied to take a bath, so closed?
sentences.chinese: 是老天爺準備沐浴而拉開布簾嗎？

sentences.english: Surely God wants us to drink this wine and celebrate our good fortune.
sentences.chinese: 老天爺一定是要我們把酒喝了，慶祝不幸中的大幸。

sentences.english: For heaven's sake, my dear girl, try a fresh start.
sentences.chinese: 老天爺，我的好姑娘，求你從頭講一遍。

sentences.english: God, this was even harder than I remembered.
sentences.chinese: 老天爺，這比我能想起來的更加艱難。

sentences.english: And I'm saying thank heaven for that.
sentences.chinese: 多謝老天爺我有個乖乖女。

sentences.english: Heaven save me, or I'm a done man.
sentences.chinese: 老天爺，救救我吧，莫讓我把命丟了。

sentences.english: One of God's greatest gifts to us.
sentences.chinese: 一個老天爺給我們的最偉大的禮物。

sentences.english: Lordy, we've got to have a doctor.
sentences.chinese: 老天爺呀，我們一定要有個大夫。

sentences.english: The God is intelligently good at making you the master this magic power.
sentences.chinese: 老天爺最聰明的地方，就是教你做這種魔術的主人。

definition: as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
to care for/to show concern for/to think longingly (of one's country)
right or wrong?/Is it right?/OK, yes? (colloquial)
lit. that person/fig. the person you have been looking for/Mr Right/the girl of one's dreams
to play tricks on/to make fun of/to tease
to be disappointing/to fail to live up to expectations
to suffer untold hardships (idiom); trials and tribulations/with difficulty/after some effort
